availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard L. Threldkeld (Livingston County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Virginia native. Married to Sarah Threldkeld. Father of Willis, James, William, Nora, Araminta, and Robert Threldheld. Owned eight enslaved people in Livingston County, Kentucky in 1840. Justice of the peace in Livingston County in 1850. Farmer in Livingston County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved people in Livingston County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, Division 2, Carrsville post office, p. 43.
